snippet: Anti-poverty programs unfairly shortchange childless adults.
abstract: Editorial criticizes the 26 mostly Republican-led states for refusing to expand their Medicaid programs, as called for under the health reform law; observes their refusal means at least four million childless adults will be denied coverage; notes other ways anti-poverty programs fail to meet the needs of the poor and childless.
lead_paragraph: Anti-poverty programs unfairly shortchange childless adults.

headline.main: It’s Not Only Mothers and Children
headline.print_headline: It’s Not Only Mothers and Children

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
